skill.name: refactor-assistant
skill.description: Automated code refactoring suggestions and implementation.
skill.summary: Automated code refactoring suggestions and implementation.
skill.author: CuriousLearner

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no code execution, file system access, network calls, or environment variable reads. Contains only AI instructions for code refactoring assistance.

content.value_statement: Codebases become harder to maintain as technical debt accumulates over time. This skill provides systematic refactoring suggestions and helps implement improvements while preserving existing functionality.
actual_capabilities: Analyze code for smells and complexity issues
Suggest Extract Method and Function refactoring patterns
Identify naming inconsistencies and SOLID violations
Propose incremental refactoring with risk assessment
Apply patterns like Extract Class and Remove Dead Code
limitations: Cannot modify files without explicit user approval
Requires existing test coverage for safe refactoring
Does not execute code or run tests automatically

use_cases.title: Modernize Legacy Code
use_cases.description: Improve maintainability of aging codebases through systematic refactoring patterns

use_cases.title: Enforce Code Standards
use_cases.description: Apply consistent refactoring patterns across team codebases for better quality

use_cases.title: Learn Refactoring Techniques
use_cases.description: Understand refactoring patterns through AI-guided examples and explanations

prompt_templates.title: Basic Refactor Request
prompt_templates.prompt: Refactor this code and suggest improvements for better maintainability

prompt_templates.title: Focus on Complexity
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze this code for high cyclomatic complexity and suggest ways to simplify the logic

prompt_templates.title: Find Code Smells
prompt_templates.prompt: Identify code smells in this code including duplicate code, long functions, and naming issues

prompt_templates.title: Apply Patterns
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply Extract Method, Extract Class, and Remove Dead Code patterns where appropriate

best_practices: Always verify tests pass after each refactoring change
Make small incremental changes instead of large rewrites
Get explicit approval before making structural changes
anti_patterns: Changing code behavior while refactoring structure
Attempting to refactor untested or unstable code

faq.question: What programming languages does this skill support?
faq.answer: Works with any programming language. Refactoring patterns apply broadly across JavaScript, Python, Java, Go, and other languages.

faq.question: What size codebases can this skill handle?
faq.answer: Can analyze anything from single files to entire directories. Larger codebases benefit from focusing on specific areas first.

faq.question: Does this skill modify my code automatically?
faq.answer: No. It suggests refactoring and waits for your approval before making any changes to your codebase.

faq.question: How does the skill assess refactoring quality?
faq.answer: Uses established patterns from Martin Fowler's refactoring catalog and SOLID design principles to evaluate code improvements.

faq.question: Is refactoring safe for production code?
faq.answer: Safety depends on test coverage. The skill recommends ensuring tests exist before refactoring and running them after changes.

faq.question: How is this different from linters and formatters?
faq.answer: Linters fix style and syntax. This skill improves code structure and design patterns through systematic refactoring transformations.
